adverbs.description: absorbedly (comparative more absorbedly, superlative most absorbedly)

entries.meaning: In a manner as if wholly engrossed or engaged. [First attested in the mid 19th century.]
examples: Michael O’Shea continued absorbedly gazing on the picture, till the welcome smell of a tumbler of Mr. Hoolagan’s whisky suddenly restored him to comparative serenity.
